intro: Hieracium odontinum, commonly known as the toothed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium odontinum is often found in temperate regions and is relatively hardy, though it can be invasive in some areas.
